question_text: A 45-year-old man presents with painless swelling of the left elbow.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: This patient has olecranon bursitis (Option C). This condition is a frequent cause of elbow swelling and presents as a ballottable swelling of the posterior elbow, sometimes with erythema and tenderness. Causes include trauma, infection (septic arthritis), and rheumatologic conditions (rheumatoid, reactive, or psoriatic arthritis; gout). Swelling with pain on elbow extension and reduced range of motion suggest infection or active inflammation.
